intro: Saurauia plurilocularis, commonly known as the clustered saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its compact shrub form, with small, glossy leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
